quotes.text: “I do not fear computers. I fear lack of them.”
quotes.author: Isaac Asimov

quotes.text: “A computer once beat me at chess, but it was no match for me at kick boxing.”
quotes.author: Emo Philips

quotes.text: “Computer Science is no more about computers than astronomy is about telescopes.”
quotes.author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

quotes.text: “The computer was born to solve problems that did not exist before.”
quotes.author: Bill Gates

quotes.text: “Software is like entropy: It is difficult to grasp, weighs nothing, and obeys the Second Law of Thermodynamics; i.e., it always increases.”
quotes.author: Norman Augustine

quotes.text: “Software is a gas; it expands to fill its container.”
quotes.author: Nathan Myhrvold

quotes.text: “All parts should go together without forcing.  You must remember that the parts you are reassembling were disassembled by you.  Therefore, if you can’t get them together again, there must be a reason.  By all means, do not use a hammer.”
quotes.author: IBM Manual, 1925

quotes.text: “Standards are always out of date.  That’s what makes them standards.”
quotes.author: Alan Bennett

quotes.text: “Physics is the universe’s operating system.”
quotes.author: Steven R Garman

quotes.text: “It’s hardware that makes a machine fast.  It’s software that makes a fast machine slow.”
quotes.author: Craig Bruce

quotes.text: “The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it is the illusion of knowledge.”
quotes.author: Stephen Hawking

quotes.text: “The more you know, the more you realize you know nothing.”
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.text: “Tell me and I forget.  Teach me and I remember.  Involve me and I learn.”
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: “Real knowledge is to know the extent of one’s ignorance.”
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: “If people never did silly things, nothing intelligent would ever get done.”
quotes.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quotes.text: “Getting information off the Internet is like taking a drink from a fire hydrant.”
quotes.author: Mitchell Kapor

quotes.text: “If you think your users are idiots, only idiots will use it.”
quotes.author: Linus Torvalds

quotes.text: “From a programmer’s point of view, the user is a peripheral that types when you issue a read request.”
quotes.author: P. Williams

quotes.text: “Where is the ‘any’ key?”
quotes.author: Homer Simpson, in response to the message, “Press any key”

quotes.text: “Computers are good at following instructions, but not at reading your mind.”
quotes.author: Donald Knuth

quotes.text: “There is only one problem with common sense; it’s not very common.”
quotes.author: Milt Bryce

quotes.text: “Your most unhappy customers are your greatest source of learning.”
quotes.author: Bill Gates

quotes.text: “The Internet?  We are not interested in it.”
quotes.author: Bill Gates, 1993

quotes.text: “In a room full of top software designers, if two agree on the same thing, that’s a majority.”
quotes.author: Bill Curtis

quotes.text: “Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.”
quotes.author: Abelson and Sussman

quotes.text: “Commenting your code is like cleaning your bathroom — you never want to do it, but it really does create a more pleasant experience for you and your guests.”
quotes.author: Ryan Campbell

quotes.text: “We have to stop optimizing for programmers and start optimizing for users.”
quotes.author: Jeff Atwood

quotes.text: “Low-level programming is good for the programmer’s soul.”
quotes.author: John Carmack

quotes.text: “It’s OK to figure out murder mysteries, but you shouldn’t need to figure out code.  You should be able to read it.”
quotes.author: Steve McConnell

quotes.text: “If we wish to count lines of code, we should not regard them as ‘lines produced’ but as ‘lines spent.'”
quotes.author: Edsger Dijkstra

quotes.text: “Programming can be fun, so can cryptography; however they should not be combined.”
quotes.author: Kreitzberg and Shneiderman

quotes.text: “Before software should be reusable, it should be usable.”
quotes.author: Ralph Johnson

quotes.text: “If you automate a mess, you get an automated mess.”
quotes.author: Rod Michael

quotes.text: “Looking at code you wrote more than two weeks ago is like looking at code you are seeing for the first time.”
quotes.author: Dan Hurvitz

quotes.text: “It is easier to change the specification to fit the program than vice versa.”
quotes.author: Alan Perlis

quotes.text: “If you have a procedure with ten parameters, you probably missed some.”
quotes.author: Alan Perlis

quotes.text: “Simplicity, carried to the extreme, becomes elegance.”
quotes.author: Jon Franklin

quotes.text: “A program is never less than 90% complete, and never more than 95% complete.”
quotes.author: Terry Baker

quotes.text: “When you are stuck in a traffic jam with a Porsche, all you do is burn more gas in idle.  Scalability is about building wider roads, not about building faster cars.”
quotes.author: Steve Swartz

quotes.text: “The best way to predict the future is to implement it.”
quotes.author: David Heinemeier Hansson

quotes.text: “We need above all to know about changes; no one wants or needs to be reminded 16 hours a day that his shoes are on.”
quotes.author: David Hubel

quotes.text: “Make everything as simple as possible, but not simpler.”
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: “Today, most software exists, not to solve a problem, but to interface with other software.”
quotes.author: IO Angell

quotes.text: “Good specifications will always improve programmer productivity far better than any programming tool or technique.”
quotes.author: Milt Bryce

quotes.text: “The difference between theory and practice is that in theory, there is no difference between theory and practice.”
quotes.author: Richard Moore

quotes.text: “As a rule, software systems do not work well until they have been used, and have failed repeatedly, in real applications.”
quotes.author: Dave Parnas

quotes.text: “If the code and the comments do not match, possibly both are incorrect.”
quotes.author: Norm Schryer

quotes.text: “I think it’s a new feature.  Don’t tell anyone it was an accident.”
quotes.author: Larry Wall

quotes.text: “When debugging, novices insert corrective code; experts remove defective code.”
quotes.author: Richard Pattis

quotes.text: “In a software project team of 10, there are probably 3 people who produce enough defects to make them net negative producers.”
quotes.author: Gordon Schulmeyer

quotes.text: “I think it is inevitable that people program poorly.  Training will not substantially help matters.  We have to learn to live with it.”
quotes.author: Alan Perlis

quotes.text: “Program testing can be a very effective way to show the presence of bugs, but is hopelessly inadequate for showing their absence.”
quotes.author: Edsger Dijkstra

quotes.text: “There’s no obfuscated Perl contest because it’s pointless.”
quotes.author: Jeff Polk

quotes.text: “Java is the most distressing thing to hit computing since MS-DOS.”
quotes.author: Alan Kay

quotes.text: “There are only two things wrong with C++:  The initial concept and the implementation.”
quotes.author: Bertrand Meyer

quotes.text: “BASIC is to computer programming as QWERTY is to typing.”
quotes.author: Seymour Papert

quotes.text: “It has been discovered that C++ provides a remarkable facility for concealing the trivial details of a program — such as where its bugs are.”
quotes.author: David Keppel

quotes.text: “UNIX is simple.  It just takes a genius to understand its simplicity.”
quotes.author: Dennis Ritchie

quotes.text: “Some people, when confronted with a problem, think ‘I know, I’ll use regular expressions.’  Now they have two problems.”
quotes.author: Jamie Zawinski

quotes.text: “The only truly secure system is one that is powered off, cast in a block of concrete and sealed in a lead-lined room with armed guards.”
quotes.author: Gene Spafford

quotes.text: “I am not out to destroy Microsoft, that would be a completely unintended side effect.”
quotes.author: Linus Torvalds

quotes.text: “Two years from now, spam will be solved.”
quotes.author: Bill Gates, 2004

quotes.text: “The problem of viruses is temporary and will be solved in two years.”
quotes.author: John McAfee, 1988

quotes.text: “Computer viruses are an urban legend.”
quotes.author: Peter Norton, 1988

quotes.text: “In 2031, lawyers will be commonly a part of most development teams.”
quotes.author: Grady Booch

quotes.text: “In the future, computers may weigh no more than 1.5 tonnes.”
quotes.author: Popular mechanics, 1949

quotes.text: “I see little commercial potential for the Internet for at least ten years.”
quotes.author: Bill Gates, 1994
